English: <s>The Migration Regulations provide that a person who is or becomes the subject of a resolution of the Security Council which requires Australia to prevent that person entering or transiting through Australian territory is unable to be granted a visa, or, if a visa has already been granted, to have his or her visa cancelled, consistent with the obligations in the relevant Council resolution.</s>
Spanish: <s>Los Reglamentos de Migración establecen que una persona que es o se convierte en el sujeto de una resolución del Consejo de Seguridad de las Naciones Unidas que requiere a Australia para prevenir que esa persona entre o transite por el territorio australiano, no puede ser concedido un visado, o, si ya se le ha concedido un visado, no puede tenerlo cancelado, en consonancia con las obligaciones establecidas en la resolución del Consejo de Seguridad de las Naciones Unidas.</s>
The Migration Regulations provide that a person who is or becomes the subject of a resolution of the Security Council which requires Australia to prevent that person entering or transiting through Australian territory is unable to be granted a visa, or, if a visa has already been granted, to have his or her visa cancelled, consistent with the obligations in the relevant Council resolution.
The Migration Regulations provide that a person who is or becomes the subject of a resolution of the Security Council which requires Australia to prevent that person entering or transiting through Australian territory is unable to be granted a visa, or, if a visa has already been granted, to have his or her visa cancelled, consistent with the obligations in the relevant Council resolution.

English: <s>United Nations Integrated Mission in Timor-Leste</s>
Spanish: <s>Misión integrada de las Naciones Unidas en Timor-Leste</s>
French: <s>Mission intégrée des Nations Unies au Timor-Leste</s>
Portuguese: <s>Missão Integrada das Nações Unidas no Timor-Leste</s>
The United Nations Integrated Mission in Timor-Leste (UNMIT) is a United Nations peacekeeping mission in Timor-Leste. It was established by the United Nations Security Council Resolution 1704 on 25 May 2006. It replaced the United Nations Transitional Administration in East Timor (UNTAET) and the United Nations Mission of Support in East Timor (UNMISET), which had been in place since 1999.
UNMIT's mandate is to assist the Government of Timor-Leste and the United Nations Transitional Administration in East Timor (UNTAET/UNMISET) in the implementation of the United Nations Transitional Administration in East Timor (UNTAET) and the United Nations Mission of Support in East Timor (UNMISET).
UNMIT's mandate is to assist the Government of Timor-Leste and the United Nations Transitional Administration in East Timor (UNTAET/UNMISET) in the implementation of the United Nations Transitional Administration in East Timor (UNTAET
--------------------

English: <s>113. The Special Committee stresses that peacekeeping operations need to be complemented with activities aimed at effectively improving the living conditions of the affected populations, including quick implementation of highly effective and visible projects that help to create jobs and deliver basic social services in the postconflict phase.</s>
Spanish: <s>113. El Comité especial subraya que las operaciones de mantenimiento de la paz necesitan complementarse con actividades dirigidas a mejorar las condiciones de vida de las poblaciones afectadas, incluyendo la rápida implementación de proyectos eficaces y visibles que ayuden a crear puestos de trabajo y a proporcionar servicios básicos en la fase postconfluyente.</s>
Original: <s>113. The Special Committee stresses that peacekeeping operations need to be complemented with activities aimed at effectively improving the living conditions of the affected populations, including quick implementation of highly effective and visible projects that help to create jobs and deliver basic social services in the postconflict phase.</s>

English: <s>14. Sudan is a UN member since 12 November 1956, and as such, it is bound by the terms of the UN Charter including its article 25 according to which "[m]embers of the United Nations agree to accept and carry out the decisions of the Security Council in accordance with the [...] Charter".</s>
Spanish: <s>14. English: <s>However, my Government would like to recall that it was following the refusal of MONUSCO to work with the two generals appointed to command the operations against FDLR and to assist FARDC in those operations that the Government, noting that decision, and wishing to fulfil its obligations with regard to neutralizing the negative forces, was obliged to initiate the current operations against FDLR without the assistance of MONUSCO.</s>
Spanish: <s>Sin embargo, mi Gobierno desea recordar que fue a raíz de la negativa de MONUSCO a trabajar con los dos generales nombrados para dirigir las operaciones contra FDLR y auxiliar a las FARDC en dichas operaciones, que el Gobierno, tomando nota de esa decisión, y deseando cumplir con sus obligaciones con respecto a la neutralización de las fuerzas negativas, fue obligado a iniciar las operaciones contra FDLR sin la asistencia de MONUSCO.</s>

English: <s>2. International Tribunal for the Prosecution of Persons Responsible for Serious Violations of International Humanitarian Law Committed in the Territory of the Former Yugoslavia since 1991</s>
Spanish: <s>2. Tribunal Internacional para la Procesión de Personas Responsables de Violaciones Serias de la Ley Internacional cometidas en el Territorio de la antigua Yugoslavia desde 1991</s>
The International Tribunal for the Prosecution of Persons Responsible for Serious Violations of International Humanitarian Law Committed in the Territory of the Former Yugoslavia since 1991 (International Criminal Tribunal for the former Yugoslavia, ICTY) was established in 1993 by the Security Council of the United Nations (UNSC) in Resolution 827 (1993) to prosecute persons responsible for serious violations of international humanitarian law committed in the territory of the former Yugoslavia since 1991.
The ICTY was the first international criminal tribunal to be established since the Nuremberg and Tokyo tribunals after World War II, and the first to be established by the Security Council of the United Nations.
The ICTY is located in The Hague, Netherlands.
The ICTY was established in 1993 by the Security Council of the United Nations (UNSC) in Resolution 827 (1993) to prosecute persons responsible for serious violations of international humanitarian law committed in the territory of the former Yugoslavia since 1991.
The ICTY was the first international criminal tribunal to be established since the Nuremberg and Tokyo tribunals after World War II, and the first to be established by the Security Council of the United
--------------------

English: <s>319. The Inspector concludes that the Office should initiate steps to require mandate holders, effective from 2015, to make full disclosure to the Human Rights Council of all forms of support, including funding and any conditions attached to them, that they receive from sources other than the Office, in order to increase transparency and independence and to dispel misgivings.</s>
Spanish: <s>319. El Inspector concluye que la Oficina debería iniciar pasos para exigir a los mandatarios, a partir de 2015, que hagan una declaración completa al Consejo de Derechos Humanos de todas las formas de apoyo, incluyendo financiación y cualquier condición que se les imponga, que reciben de fuentes otras que no sean la Oficina, para aumentar la transparencia y la independencia y despejar dudas.</s>
Portuguese: <s>319. O Inspector conclui que a Oficina deverá iniciar passos para exigir aos mandatários, a partir de 2015, que façam uma declaração completa ao Conselho de Direitos Humanos sobre todas as formas de apoio, incluindo financiamento e qualquer condição que lhes seja imposta, que recebam de fontes outras que não sejam a Oficina, para aumentar a transparência e a independência e despejar dúvidas.</s>

English: <s>10. The lower requirement under facilities and infrastructure ($3.8 million) is mainly due to: (a) the reprioritization of funds to meet the additional costs of the Ebola outbreak; (b) lower fuel prices; and (c) the classification of freight to the "other supplies, services and equipment" class of expenditure in line with the new chart of accounts.</s>
Spanish: <s>10. La baja exigencia bajo infraestructuras y servicios ($3.8 millones) se debe principalmente a: (a) la reprioritización de fondos para cubrir los costos adicionales de la epidemia de Ebola; (b) los precios más bajos del petróleo; y (c) la clasificación de los costos de transporte a la "Otros servicios, suministros y equipo" clase de gastos en línea con el nuevo cuadro de cuentas.</s>

English: <s>As I have stated on numerous occasions, the region as a whole shares my country's concern over the British militarization of the South Atlantic, which has been denounced by various international forums because it creates an unnecessary and unjustified tension in the South Atlantic, a nuclear-weapon-free zone characterized by its commitment to peace.</s>

English: <s>18. The Final Document of the 2010 NPT Review Conference endorsed additional steps aimed at supporting the implementation of the 1995 Resolution, including that IAEA, the Organization for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons and other relevant international organizations be requested to prepare background documentation for the 2012 Conference regarding modalities for a zone free of nuclear weapons and other weapons of mass destruction and their delivery systems, taking into account work previously undertaken and experience gained.</s>
Spanish: <s>18. El documento final de la Conferencia de revisión del 2010 de la NPT, aprobó medidas adicionales para apoyar la implementación de la Resolución de 1995, incluyendo que la Agencia Internacional de Energía Atómica (IAEA), la Organización para la Prohibición de Armas Químicas (OPCW) y otras organizaciones internacionales sean requeridas para preparar documentos de fondo para la Conferencia de revisión de 2012 sobre una zona libre de armas nucleares y otras armas de destrucción masiva y sus sistemas de lanzamiento, tomando en cuenta el trabajo ya realizado y la experiencia adquirida.</s>

English: <s>2. Even if the mediation instrument contains an international commercial settlement agreement, in order for that instrument to have the effect of an enforceable ruling and of res judicata, it must result from mediation proceedings with the participation of a mediator accredited by a mediation centre registered with the Council of the Judiciary.</s>
Spanish: <s>2. Aunque el instrumento de mediación contenga un acuerdo de resolución de controversias internacionales, para que dicho instrumento tenga el efecto de una resolución judicial y de res judicata, debe resultar de procedimientos de mediación con la participación de un mediador acreditado por un centro de mediación registrado con el Consejo de la Judicatura.</s>

English: <s>26. Gender architecture and parity remains a particularly weak area across the United Nations system, with only 21 per cent of ratings falling into the "meets" or "exceeds" categories, and a very slow rate of progress of a 1 percentage point increase in entities rated as "meets" or "exceeds" requirements from 2013 to 2014.</s>
Spanish: <s>26. La arquitectura del género y la paridad siguen siendo un área particularmente débil en el sistema de las Naciones Unidas, con sólo el 21 por ciento de las calificaciones cayendo en las categorías "meets" o "exceeds", y un ritmo de progreso lento de un punto porcentual en las entidades calificadas como "meets" o "exceeds" las exigencias de 2013 a 2014.</s>

Spanish: <s>En consecuencia, el presente informe pretende proporcionar una visión general de los progresos realizados en la implementación del Plan de Acción, incluyendo los planes específicos de remediación, las lecciones aprendidas y los próximos pasos, y en la integración de la igualdad de género en los procesos comunes de programación de los Estados miembros, incluyendo a través de los Planes de Desarrollo y otros procesos de planificación.</s>

English: <s>Although knowledge of the consequences and risks is not new -- and indeed was one of the key drivers for the negotiation and agreement of the Treaty on the NonProliferation of Nuclear Weapons -- the compelling body of evidence that has been presented to the international community since the last Review Conference in 2010 has served to heighten awareness of the scale and extent of the consequences and thus the risks that will persist until nuclear weapons are eliminated.</s>
Spanish: <s>Aunque el conocimiento de las consecuencias y de los riesgos no es nuevo –y de hecho fue uno de los factores clave para la negociación y el acuerdo del Tratado de No Proliferación de Armas Nucleares (TNPANU)– la avalancha de evidencia que se ha presentado a la comunidad internacional desde la última Conferencia de Revisión en 2010 ha servido para incrementar la conciencia de las consecuencias y de los riesgos que seguirán existiendo hasta que las armas nucleares sean eliminadas.</s>

English: <s>20. The Conference of Ministers, inter alia, endorsed the Vienna Programme of Action for Landlocked Developing Countries for the Decade 2014-2024 and requested the Executive Secretary of the Economic Commission for Africa to mainstream the Vienna Programme of Action into the programme of work of the Commission, as appropriate and within its mandate, and to submit analytical reports on the implementation of the Programme of Action, as called for in its paragraph 75.</s>
Spanish: <s>20. El Consejo de Ministros, por otra parte, aprobó el Programa de Acción de la Conferencia de Ministros para los Países Terrestres Desarrollo Lácteos, para el Decenio 2014-2024 y solicitó al Secretario Ejecutivo de la Comisión Económica para África que incluyera el Programa de Acción de la Conferencia de Ministros en el programa de trabajo de la Comisión, en la medida de lo posible y dentro de su mandato, y que presentara informes analíticos sobre la implementación del Programa de Acción de la Conferencia de Ministros, como se indica en su artículo 75.</s>

English: <s>The United Nations continues to prioritize and strengthen the timely recruitment and deployment of skilled and experienced humanitarian staff, while remaining committed to the need for diversity in geographical representation and gender balance.</s>

English: <s>United Nations Mission in Sierra Leone</s>
Spanish: <s>Misión de las Naciones Unidas en Sierra León</s>
French: <s>Mission des Nations Unies en Sierra Leone</s>
Portuguese: <s>Missão das Nações Unidas em Sierra Leão</s>
The United Nations Mission in Sierra Leone (UNAMSIL) was a United Nations peacekeeping mission in Sierra Leone from 1999 to 2003. It was the largest peacekeeping mission in the world at the time, with 16,000 military personnel and 2,000 civilian staff.
The mission was established by the United Nations Security Council in 1999 in response to the Sierra Leone Civil War, which had been raging since 1991. The mission's mandate was to restore peace and security in Sierra Leone, protect civilians, and assist in the disarmament, demobilization, and reintegration (DDR) of former combatants.
The United Nations Mission in Sierra Leone was succeeded by the United Nations Mission in Sierra Leone and Liberia (UNMIL) in 2003.
The United Nations Mission in Sierra Leone (UNAMSIL) was a United Nations peacekeeping mission in Sierra Leone from 1999 to 2003. It was the largest peacekeeping mission in the world at the time, with 16,000 military personnel and 2,000 civilian staff.
The United Nations Mission in Sierra Leone

English: <s>19.52 The objective of the subprogramme and expected accomplishments will be achieved assuming that the global, regional and national environments remain conducive: (a) to continued collaboration on strengthening regional economic integration; (b) to promoting and supporting sustainable agriculture and food security; (c) to supporting the efforts of least developed countries to enhance their productive capacities; and (d) to determining that adequate extrabudgetary resources are mobilized to ensure the necessary outreach and depth of technical cooperation activities.</s>
Spanish: <s>19.52 El objetivo del subprograma y los logros esperados se lograrán teniendo en cuenta que los ambientes global, regional y nacional sean propicios: (a) a la continuidad de la colaboración para fortalecer la integración económica regional; (b) a la promoción y el apoyo al desarrollo sostenible de la agricultura y la seguridad alimentaria; (c) a la promoción de los esfuerzos de los países menos desarrollados para aumentar sus capacidades productivas; y (d) a la determinación de que los recursos extrabudgétarios sean suficientes para asegurar el alcance y profundidad de las actividades de cooperación técnica.</s>

Spanish: <s>Además, solicitan que la Comisión recomiende que se elimine la discriminación de la ley local (declaración) (número 4.) y que se apliquen las disposiciones de la ley de sucesión indígena (declaración) (número 4.) y de la ley de herencia y de la administración de herencias (declaración) (número 4.) a las mujeres que siguen siendo sujetas a las normas de herencia según la ley local (declaración) (número 4.)</s>

English: <s>5. The 1995 Review and Extension Conference of the Parties to the Treaty on the Non-Proliferation of Nuclear Weapons placed emphasis on conditions required to secure the effectiveness of the Treaty, now extended indefinitely, through stressing the importance of maintaining parallel progress in nuclear non-proliferation in all its aspects, nuclear disarmament and peaceful uses of nuclear energy, while pursuing vigorous efforts to attain Treaty universality.</s>
Spanish: <s>5. La Conferencia de Revisión y Extensión del Tratado de No Proliferación de Armas Nucleares enfatizó las condiciones necesarias para asegurar la eficacia del Tratado, ahora extendido indefinidamente, a través de subrayar la importancia de la progresión paralela en la no proliferación de armas nucleares en todos sus aspectos, la desarme nuclear y las energías nucleares pacíficas, mientras se persigue con vigorosos esfuerzos para alcanzar la universalidad del Tratado.</s>

English: <s>8. To be credible, negative security assurances should be codified in the framework of a legally binding multilateral agreement banning the use or the threat of use of nuclear weapons against non-nuclear-weapon States provided that they are in compliance with the non-proliferation commitments made under Articles II and III of the NPT.</s>
Spanish: <s>8. Para ser creíble, las garantías de seguridad negativas deben ser codificadas en el marco de un acuerdo multilateral legalmente vinculante que prohíba el uso o la amenaza de uso de armas nucleares contra Estados no nucleares que estén en cumplimiento de los compromisos de no proliferación establecidos en los artículos II y III de la NPT.</s>

English: <s>24. In December 2014, UN-Habitat launched a multi-stakeholder initiative to develop guidelines for city climate action plans, with a target launch date for version 1.0 planned for December 2015, at the twenty-first session of the Conference of the Parties to the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change in Paris.</s>
Spanish: <s>24. En diciembre de 2014, la Organización de las Naciones Unidas para la Alimentación y la Agricultura (FAO) y la Organización de las Naciones Unidas para las Ciudades y los Pueblos (UN-Habitat) lanzaron una iniciativa multiestatal para la elaboración de directrices para planes de acción de las ciudades sobre el cambio climático, con un objetivo de lanzamiento previsto para la versión 1.0 para diciembre de 2015, en la vigésima primera sesión de la Conferencia de las Naciones Unidas sobre el Cambio Climático en París.</s>
French: <s>24. En décembre 2014, l’Organisation des Nations Unies pour l’alimentation et l’agriculture (FAO) et l’Organisation des Nations Unies pour les villes et les populations (UN-Habitat) ont lancé une initiative multi-stakeholders pour l’élaboration de directives pour les plans d’action des villes sur le changement climatique, avec un objectif de lancement prévu pour la version 1.0 pour décembre 2015, à la vingt-et-unième session de la Conférence des Nations Unies sur le Changement Climatique à Paris.</s>

English: <s>The NATO International Security Force in Kosovo (KFOR), deployed as the international security presence alongside UNMIK, maintains some 5,000 troops on the ground and performs the role of the third emergency responder, after the Kosovo Police and EULEX.</s>
Spanish: <s>La Fuerza Internacional de Seguridad de la OTAN en Kosovo (KFOR), desplazada como presencia internacional de seguridad junto al UNMIK, mantiene a unos 5.000 soldados en el terreno y desempeña el papel de tercer emergente, después de la Policía del Kosovo y EULEX.</s>
NATO International Security Force in Kosovo (KFOR)
The NATO International Security Force in Kosovo (KFOR), deployed as the international security presence alongside the United Nations Interim Administration Mission in Kosovo (UNMIK), maintains some 5,000 troops on the ground and performs the role of the third emergency responder, after the Kosovo Police and the European Union Rule of Law Mission in Kosovo (EULEX).
KFOR was established in 1999 by the North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO) and the United Nations Security Council (UNSC) Resolution 1244 (1999) to maintain peace and security in Kosovo. KFOR's mandate was extended by the UNSC Resolution 1244 (2003) and by the UNSC Resolution 1244 (2005).
KFOR is led by the Supreme Allied Commander Europe (SACEUR), who is also the Commander of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO) Allied Command Operations (ACO). The current SACEUR is General Curtis M. Scaparrotti.
KFOR's
--------------------

English: <s>108. Since 2015 coincides with the African Union's Year for Women's Empowerment and Development towards Agenda 2063, the twentieth anniversary of the Beijing Declaration and the midpoint of the African Women's Decade, the United Nations system should further strengthen its coordination and enhance its support towards accelerating the implementation of all commitments relating to gender equality and women's empowerment made in these frameworks.</s>
Spanish: <s>108. Desde 2015, coincidiendo con el Año de la Unión Africana para la Emancipación de la Mujer y el Desarrollo hacia el Año 2063, la Declaración de Beijing y el medio punto de la Decenio Africana de la Mujer, la Sistema de las Naciones Unidas debería fortalecer su coordinación y aumentar su apoyo hacia la aceleración de la implementación de todos los compromisos relacionados con la igualdad de género y la emancipación de la mujer establecidos en estos documentos.</s>

English: <s>1. In 2003, the International Criminal Tribunal for Rwanda ("the Tribunal") formalized a strategy ("the completion strategy") to achieve the objectives of completing investigations by the end of 2004, all trial activities at first instance by the end of 2008 and all of its work in 2010, in accordance with Security Council resolution 1503 (2003).</s>
Spanish: <s>1. En 2003, la Corte Penal Internacional para Rwanda ("la Corte") formalizó una estrategia ("la estrategia de completación") para lograr los objetivos de completar las investigaciones por el final de 2004, todas las actividades del primer grado por el final de 2008 y todas las actividades de la Corte por el final de 2010, en conformidad con la resolución 1503 (2003) del Consejo de Seguridad de las Naciones Unidas.</s>
French: <s>1. En 2003, la Cour pénale internationale pour le Rwanda ("la Cour") a formalisé une stratégie ("la stratégie de complétion") pour atteindre les objectifs de compléter les enquêtes par la fin de 2004, toutes les activités du premier degré par la fin de 2008 et toutes les activités de la Cour par la fin de 2010, conformément à la résolution 1503 (2003) du Conseil de sécurité des Nations Unies.</s>
Portuguese: <s>1. Em 2003, a Corte Penal Internacional para o Rwanda ("a Corte") formalizou uma estratégia ("a estratégia de completação") para alcançar os objetivos de completar as investigações por o final de 2004

English: <s>The efforts of FARDC will now focus mainly on the Kalehe, Kabare and Walungu roads in this province, as well as the roads of North Kivu province that have not yet been cleared of FDLR.</s>

French: <s>Les efforts de FARDC se concentreront maintenant principalement sur les routes de Kalehe, Kabare et Walungu dans cette province, ainsi que sur les routes de Kivu Nord qui n'ont pas encore été nettoyées des FDLR.</s>
Kinshasa, 29 July 2010 – The United Nations Mission in the Democratic Republic of the Congo (MONUC) and the United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in the Democratic Republic of the Congo (MONUSCO) welcome the announcement by the Government of the Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC) that the FARDC will now focus mainly on the Kalehe, Kabare and Walungu roads in South Kivu province, as well as the roads of North Kivu province that have not yet been cleared of FDLR.
The announcement was made by the Minister of National Defense and Veterans Affairs, Mr. Alexis Thambwe Mwamba, at a press conference in Kinshasa on 28 July 2010.
MONUC and MONUSCO call on the Government of the DRC to ensure that the FARDC

English: <s>2. For the purposes of these Principles, a contract is international unless each party has its establishment in the same State and the relationship of the parties and all other relevant elements, regardless of the chosen law, are connected only with that State.</s>
Spanish: <s>2. Para los fines de estos Principios, un contrato es internacional si cada una de las partes tiene su establecimiento en el mismo Estado y la relación de las partes y todos los demás elementos relevantes, independientemente de la ley elegida, están conectados sólo con ese Estado.</s>

English: <s>114. Since 1967, Israel has continued to occupy the Syrian Golan, despite numerous resolutions of various United Nations bodies, including Security Council resolution 497 (1981), in which the Council deemed Israel's decision to impose its laws, jurisdiction and administration on the occupied Syrian Golan null and void, and called upon Israel to desist from the establishment of settlements and altering the demographic composition of occupied territory.</s>
Spanish: <s>114. Desde 1967, Israel continúa ocupando el Golan, a pesar de numerosas resoluciones de diversos organismos de las Naciones Unidas, incluyendo resolución 497 (1981), en la cual el Consejo de Seguridad de las Naciones Unidas consideró la decisión de Israel de imponer sus leyes, jurisdicción y administración en el Golan ocupado como nulo y sin efecto, y llamó a Israel a desistir de la implantación de colonizaciones y de alterar la composición demográfica del territorio ocupado.</s>

English: <s>The 2010 Nuclear Posture Review underscores that the United States would only consider the use of nuclear weapons in extreme circumstances to defend the vital interests of the United States or its allies and partners, and that it is in the U.S. interest, and that of all other nations, that the now nearly 70-year record of nuclear weapon non-use be extended forever.</s>
Spanish: <s>El Informe de Postura Nuclear de 2010 subraya que los Estados Unidos sólo consideraría el uso de las armas nucleares en circunstancias excepcionales para defender los intereses vitales de los Estados Unidos o de sus aliados y socios, y que es en el interés de los Estados Unidos y de todos los demás pueblos que el recuerdo de casi setenta años de no uso de las armas nucleares se extienda para siempre.</s>
English: <s>The 2010 Nuclear Posture Review underscores that the United States would only consider the use of nuclear weapons in extreme circumstances to defend the vital interests of the United States or its allies and partners, and that it is in the U.S. interest, and that of all other nations, that the now nearly 70-year record of nuclear weapon non-use be extended forever.</s>

English: <s>38. The Secretary-General states that, over the course of the five-year implementation period of the global field support strategy, a new service delivery model has been defined and developed which no longer views each field mission as a stand-alone entity, but which prioritizes functional specialization at each level of the Organization, with different entities operating as part of a single field support system, thereby allowing a greater concentration of expertise and consistent service delivery.</s>
Spanish: <s>38. The International Tribunal for the Prosecution of Persons Responsible for Serious Violations of International Humanitarian Law Committed in the Territory of the Former Yugoslavia since 1991 (also known as the International Criminal Tribunal for the former Yugoslavia or ICTY) was established by the United Nations Security Council in 1993 to prosecute persons responsible for serious violations of international humanitarian law committed in the territory of the former Yugoslavia since 1991.
The ICTY was the first international war crimes tribunal to be established since the Nuremberg and Tokyo tribunals, and the first to be established in Europe since the Nuremberg and Tokyo tribunals. It was also the first international war crimes tribunal to be established since the Nuremberg and Tokyo tribunals, and the first to be established in Europe since the Nuremberg and Tokyo tribunals.
The ICTY was established by the United Nations Security Council in 1993 to prosecute persons responsible for serious violations of international humanitarian law committed in the territory of the former Yugoslavia since 1991. English: <s>It would be an incomprehensible and unjustifiable irony if, instead being duly punished, the party that has obstructed and stalled is rewarded for its intransigence, as would be the case if the fundamental elements that define the conflict were to be abandoned, including decolonization, the right to self-determination, the protection of human rights and ending the plundering of natural resources in a non-self-governing territory, in accordance with the Charter of the United Nations, Chapter XI, Article 73.</s>
Spanish: <s>Sería una ironía incomprensible y injustificable si, en lugar de ser castigado, el partido que ha obstaculizado y estrangulado se ve recompensado por su intransigencia, como sería el caso si los elementos fundamentales que definen el conflicto fueran a ser abandonados, incluyendo la decolonización, el derecho a la autodeterminación, la protección de los derechos humanos y el fin de la explotación de los recursos naturales en un territorio no autónomo, en conformidad con el Artículo 73 del Tratado de las Naciones Unidas, Capítulo XI.</s>

English: <s>20. The results of such vast reforms were reassuring: in 2013, its gross domestic product (GDP) had grown to 6.5 per cent (almost the double the rate of 2011); inflation, at 1 per cent, had finally been brought under control and the budget deficit had been substantially reduced down to 3.6 per cent of GDP.</s>
Spanish: <s>20. Los resultados de tales reformas fueron tranquilizadores: en 2013, su producto interno bruto (PIB) había crecido a 6,5 por ciento (aproximadamente el doble de la tasa de 2011); la inflación, a 1 por ciento, había sido finalmente controlada y el déficit presupuestario se había reducido a 3,6 por ciento del PIB.</s>

English: <s>Since then, Iran has called for timely implementation of the plan of action which included, inter alia, an agreement to convene a regional conference in 2012 on the establishment of a Middle East zone free of nuclear weapons and all other weapons of mass destruction.</s>

English: <s>At the outset, regarding the claims of so-called "infringements of international air traffic regulations" and "violations of the national airspace of the Republic of Cyprus by Turkey", I wish, once again, to reiterate that flights within the sovereign airspace of the Turkish Republic of Northern Cyprus take place with the full knowledge and consent of the relevant authorities of the State, over which the Greek Cypriot administration in South Cyprus has no jurisdiction or right of say whatsoever.</s>
Spanish: <s>En primer lugar, con respecto a las acusaciones de "infracciones de las normas internacionales de tráfico aéreo" y "violaciones del espacio aéreo nacional de la República de Chipre por Turquía", deseo reiterar, una vez más, que los vuelos dentro del espacio aéreo soberano de la República de Chipre del Norte se llevan a cabo con la plena conciencia y consentimiento de las autoridades competentes del Estado, sobre el cual el gobierno griego en Chipre Sur no tiene ningún tipo de jurisdicción o derecho de intervención en absoluto.</s>

English: <s>8. As the International Court of Justice, in its advisory opinion of 8 July 1996 on the legality of the threat or use of nuclear weapons, decided, "there is in neither customary nor conventional international law any specific authorization of the threat or use of nuclear weapons", and "the threat or use of nuclear weapons would generally be contrary to the rules of international law applicable in armed conflict, and in particular the principles and rules of humanitarian law".</s>
Spanish: <s>8. La Corte Internacional de Justicia, en su opinión consultiva del 8 de julio de 1996 sobre la legalidad de la amenaza o uso de las armas nucleares, decidió, "no existe en el Derecho internacional no convencional ni consuetudinario ninguna autorización para la amenaza o uso de las armas nucleares", y "el uso o amenaza de las armas nucleares estaría en general en contradicción con los principios y reglas del Derecho internacional de la guerra, y en particular con los principios y reglas del Derecho internacional de la humanidad".</s>

English: <s>Thailand, Ukraine and Viet Nam have reported the most significant declines in new HIV infections among people who inject drugs during that time, while in certain countries in Asia and the Pacific, Central Asia and Eastern Europe, slow progress has given way to an apparent rise in HIV prevalence among the members of this group, of between 18 per cent and 31 per cent [1].</s>
Spanish: <s>Tailandia, Ucrania y Viet Nam han reportado los mayores descensos en las nuevas infecciones por VIH entre las personas que inyectan drogas durante ese tiempo, mientras en ciertos países de Asia y el Pacífico, Centro Asia y Europa del Este, el avance lento ha dado paso a una aparente subida en la prevalencia del VIH entre los miembros de este grupo, de entre el 18% y el 31% [1].</s>
English: <s>Thailand, Ukraine and Viet Nam have reported the most significant declines in new HIV infections among people who inject drugs during that time, while in certain countries in Asia and the Pacific, Central Asia and Eastern Europe, slow progress has given way to an apparent rise in HIV prevalence among the members of this group, of between 18% and 31% [1].</s>

English: <s>25. The Conference reaffirms the unequivocal undertaking by the nuclear-weapon States to accomplish the total elimination of their nuclear arsenals leading to nuclear disarmament, to which all States parties are committed under Article VI, and affirms the importance of achieving and maintaining a world without nuclear weapons.</s>
Spanish: <s>25. La Conferencia reafirma el compromiso inequívoco de los Estados nucleares a la eliminación total de sus arsenales nucleares conduciendo a la desarme nuclear, a la que todos los Estados partes están comprometidos bajo el artículo VI, y afirma la importancia de alcanzar y mantener un mundo sin armas nucleares.</s>
--------------------
English: <s>20. The Conference recognizes and welcomes the steps taken to implement the Treaty between the Russian Federation and the United States of America on Measures for the Further Reduction and Limitation of Strategic Offensive Arms, and the significant reductions in deployed and non-deployed nuclear weapons, including their declaration of dismantling nuclear weapon delivery vehicles.</s>
Spanish: <s>20. French: <s>20. Le Comité spécial apprécie les efforts continus du Département des opérations de maintien de la paix et du Département d’appui aux opérations de maintien de la paix pour la mise en œuvre des Directives sur l’intégration d’une perspective de genre dans les opérations de maintien de la paix des Nations Unies, conformément à la stratégie de mise en œuvre, y compris par l’intermédiaire des conseillères de genre militaires existantes et la désignation de conseillères de genre militaires et d’un conseiller associé de genre dans le Département des opérations de maintien de la paix

English: <s>2. Reiterates that the illicit transfer, destabilizing accumulation and misuse of small arms and light weapons fuel conflict and have devastating impact on the protection of civilians, reiterates its demand that all parties to armed conflict comply strictly with the obligations applicable to them under international humanitarian law, international human rights law and international refugee law, and stresses the need for parties to take all required measures to avoid civilian casualties, respect and protect the civilian population;</s>
Spanish: <s>2. English: <s>43. There are measures that can be used to reduce costs in implementing API systems, including the possibility of airline operators capturing passenger data at the time of booking, the use of machine-readable passports and the signing of agreements that encourage Governments and airline operators to work together in implementing an API system (as is the case in Australia).</s>
Spanish: <s>43. Hay medidas que pueden ser utilizadas para reducir los costos en la implementación de sistemas de API, incluyendo la posibilidad de que los operadores aéreos recojan datos de pasajeros en el momento de la reserva, el uso de pasaportes electrónicos y la firma de acuerdos que animan a los gobiernos y a los operadores aéreos a trabajar juntos en la implementación de un sistema de API (como sucede en Australia).</s>

English: <s>6. The export control system of Japan is based on the Foreign Exchange and Foreign Trade Act, which provides the general legal framework governing exports from Japan and external transactions, as well as on the Export Trade Control Order (Cabinet Order No. 378 of 1949) (for goods) and on the Foreign Exchange Order (Cabinet Order No. 260 of 1980) (for technologies).</s>

English: <s>Since the Koniambo plant in the North Province gradually began operations in 2012, it has generated some 8,000 new jobs, directly and indirectly, many of them for the local population.</s>

French: <s>Depuis que la centrale de Koniambo dans le nord du pays a commencé à fonctionner en 2012, elle a généré plus de 8.000 nouveaux emplois, directs et indirects, beaucoup d'entre eux pour la population locale.</s>

Koniambo is a nickel and cobalt mine located in the North Province of New Caledonia. It is operated by the New Caledonia-based mining company Société Minière de Koniambo (SMK), a subsidiary of the French mining company Eramet.

English: <s>In the words of the Continental Shelf (Malta v. Libyan Arab Jamahiriya) judgment, "[i]t is of course axiomatic that the material of customary international law is to be looked for primarily in the actual practice and opinio juris of States, even though multilateral conventions may have an important role to play in recording and defining rules deriving from custom, or indeed in developing them".</s>
Spanish: <s>En las palabras de la Sentencia Continental Shelf (Malta v. Libyan Arab Jamahiriya) se dice que "es de course axiomático que el material de la ley internacional de costumbre es a buscar principalmente en la práctica y opinio juris de los Estados, aunque convenciones multilaterales pueden tener un papel importante en la recogida y definición de reglas derivadas de la costumbre, o incluso en su desarrollo".</s>

English: <s>Centrist Democrat International brings together parties, organizations and political associations that inspire ideas and behaviour within the principals of Christian humanism or integral humanism, that is to say humanism that is open to solidarity and fraternity.</s>
Spanish: <s>Centrist Democrat International brings together parties, organizations and political associations that inspire ideas and behaviour within the principals of Christian humanism or integral humanism, that is to say humanism that is open to solidarity and fraternity.</s>
French: <s>Centrist Democrat International rassemble des partis, des organisations et des associations qui inspirent des idées et des comportements au sein des principes de l’humanisme chrétien ou de l’humanisme intégral, c’est-à-dire de l’humanisme qui est ouvert à la solidarité et à la fraternité.</s>
Centrist Democrat International (CDI) is a non-profit, non-governmental, non-partisan, non-religious and non-ideological organization.
CDI was founded in 2007 by a group of European politicians, intellectuals and civil society activists.
CDI’s mission is to bring together parties, organizations and political associations that inspire ideas and behaviour within the principals of Christian humanism or integral humanism, that is to say humanism that is open to solidarity and fraternity.
CDI’s vision is to contribute to the emergence of a new political culture in Europe, based on the principles of Christian humanism or integral humanism, that is to say humanism that is open to solidarity and fraternity.
CDI’s goal is to contribute to the emergence of a new political culture in Europe, based on the principles

English: <s>9. The establishment of nuclear-weapon-free zones in different parts of the world and the creation of a nuclear-weapon-free status by a certain country, which led to the absence of nuclear weapons in the respective territories of that State and those parties to the treaties establishing such zones, are indeed other achievements in preventing the proliferation of nuclear weapons.</s>

English: <s>While transparency in the implementation of nonproliferation obligations by non-nuclear-weapon States is ensured through reports to the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) Board of Governors based on the IAEA safeguards, there exists no specific transparency mechanism for nuclear disarmament obligations of nuclear-weapon States.</s>
Spanish: <s>Mientras que la transparencia en la implementación de las obligaciones de no proliferación por parte de los Estados no nucleares es asegurada a través de informes a la Agencia Internacional de Energía Atómica (IAEA) del Consejo de Ministros basados en los controles de las Naciones Unidas, no existe ningún mecanismo específico de transparencia para las obligaciones de desarme nuclear de los Estados nucleares.</s>

English: <s>UNHCR has expanded to South Kivu its Safe Access to Fuel and Energy (SAFE) project, under which sustainable cooking fuels and alternative energy are provided, following a successful pilot in North Kivu where it helped to reduce the risk of sexual violence faced by displaced women collecting firewood and water.</s>
Spanish: <s>La Agencia de las Naciones Unidas para los Refugiados (UNHCR) ha ampliado su proyecto de acceso a la energía y los combustibles seguros (SAFE) a la región de Kivu, en República Democrática del Congo (RDC), tras el éxito del proyecto piloto en el norte de Kivu, donde ayudó a reducir el riesgo de violencia sexual a las mujeres desplazadas que recogen leña y agua.</s>
English: <s>UNHCR has expanded to South Kivu its Safe Access to Fuel and Energy (SAFE) project, under which sustainable cooking fuels and alternative energy are provided, following a successful pilot in North Kivu where it helped to reduce the risk of sexual violence faced by displaced women collecting firewood and water.</s>
Spanish: <s>La Agencia de las Naciones Unidas para los Refugiados (UNHCR) ha ampliado su proyecto de acceso a la energía y los combustibles seguros (SAFE) a la región de Kivu, en República Democrática del Congo (RDC), tras el éxito del proyecto piloto en el norte de Kivu, donde ayudó a reducir el riesgo de violencia sexual a las mujeres desplazadas que recogen leña y agua.</s>

English: <s>The Mission revived dedicated working group discussions with the parties that were initiated in November 2013 to clarify understandings of the agreement, reconcile variations in approach, address the concerns put forward by each party with regard to application of the agreement in the current operational environment and strengthen the MINURSO monitoring regime overall, in particular with regard to access to military facilities and violation definitions.</s>
Spanish: <s>La Misión reanudó las discusiones con las partes que se iniciaron en noviembre de 2013 para aclarar entendimientos del acuerdo, reconciliar las variaciones de enfoque, abordar las preocupaciones presentadas por cada parte con respecto a la aplicación del acuerdo en la actual situación operativa y fortalecer el régimen de monitoreo de la MINURSO en general, en particular con respecto a la acceso a las instalaciones militares y definiciones de violaciones.</s>

English: <s>The States of the zone have adopted a plan of action for strengthening nuclear security, preventing the proliferation of nuclear materials and combating nuclear terrorism in Central Asia.</s>
Spanish: <s>Los estados de la zona han adoptado un plan de acción para fortalecer la seguridad nuclear, prevenir la proliferación de materiales nucleares y combatir el terrorismo nuclear en la región del Cáucaso.</s>
--------------------
English: <s>The States parties to the Treaty unequivocally undertook not to allow the production, acquisition, stationing, storage or use of any nuclear weapon or other nuclear explosive device in their respective territories.</s>
Spanish: <s>Los Estados Partes a este Tratado se comprometieron inequívocamente a no permitir la producción, la adquisición, la estacionamiento, el almacenamiento o el uso de cualquier arma nuclear o explosivo nuclear en sus territorios respectivos.</s>
--------------------

Korean: <s>136회</s>
--------------------
English: <s>During the reporting period the Federation organized events in the margins of the sessions of the United Nations Commission on the Status of Women.</s>
Spanish: <s>Durante el período de reporte, la Federación organizó eventos en los margenes de las sesiones de la Comisión de la Situación de la Mujer de las Naciones Unidas.</s>
Portuguese: <s>Durante o período de relatório, a Federação organizou eventos nas margens das reuniões da Comissão das Nações Unidas sobre a Situação da Mulher.</s>
